testsuite.name: BullsCowsTest

testcase.name: start

failure.message:
java.lang.AssertionError: Wrong answer in test #2
Seems like the calculation of bulls isn't right. For the guess "7777" there can be 1 bull at max.
Please find below the output of your program during this failed test. Note that the '>' character indicates the beginning of the input line.
---
Input the length of the secret code: > 4 Input the number of possible symbols in the code: > 10 The secret is prepared: **** (0-9). Now try to guess the password: > 0000 Grade: 1 bull(s) and 3 cow(s).7705 Now try to guess the password: > 1111 Grade: None. Now try to guess the password: > 2222 Grade: None. Now try to guess the password: > 3333 Grade: None. Now try to guess the password: > 4444 Grade: None. Now try to guess the password: > 5555 Grade: 1 bull(s) and 3 cow(s). Now try to guess the password: > 6666 Grade: None. Now try to guess the password: > 7777 Grade: 2 bull(s) and 4 cow(s). Now try to guess the password:
